intro: Amerorchis rotundifolia f. immaculata, commonly known as the white-flowered purple orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and its unique, pale violet or white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are spurred at the base, a distinctive feature of the Orchidaceae family. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its beauty and rarity.
